 Array (const range &ran)
 Creates an integer array from a range.

Detailed Description

template<>
class Sylph::Array< slong >

This is a specialisation for the Array class, for integral types.

It's specialisation allows for construction through ranges, otherwise, it's functionality is equal to that of Array .

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Sylph::Array< slong >::Array ( const range &  ran  )  [inline]

Creates an integer array from a range.

The following syntax 

 Array<int>(range(X, Y));
is just shorthand for 
Array<int>(Y-X) arr;
 for(int i = X; i < Y; i++) arr[i]=X+i;
A new shared data pointer gets created. Length is equal to ran.last() - ran.first()
Parameters:
ran The range describing the contents of the array.
